intro: Ruellia geayi, commonly known as the Cape Town ruellia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. Ruellia geayi thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
